headline: Elysia viridis Photosynthesising sea-slug
text: Description This sea slug has a delicate leaf-shaped body up to 5 cm in length tapering off to a point.  Ecology This species is commonly vivid green, and occasionally bright red or brown. It feeds on seaweed and takes its colour from the seaweed's photosynthesising cells (chloroplasts). The chloroplasts are retained unharmed in its body, where they continue to photosynthesise  the sugars they produce supplement the sea slug's diet. Distribution It can be found in shallow water and rock pools in European waters, with most British records being from western coasts.
